    public class MarketplaceActivity
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
implements android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener
    Marketplace Activity where the user can post and accept trades for resources from other users

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acceptTrade(android.widget.TextView acceptButton, java.lang.String documentID)
      Check that the user and trades have been loaded in properly before proceeding to physically process the trade in the DB
      void acceptTradeDB(android.widget.TextView acceptButton, java.lang.String tradeDocumentID)
      Method called for a User (the buyer) to accept a trade; we need to process this for the current user as well as for the person who posted the trade (the seller), finally we also need to delete this trade from the trades collection in the DB; this will show a helpful toast message if the buyer does not have enough enough resources, or if previous trade actions are still being processed; when this method is invoked, it sets a flag, acceptingTrade, that only resolves once this trade is entirely finished being processed (logically and physically in DB); once done, it automatically refreshes the user's attributes at the top of the screen
      void deleteTrade(android.widget.TextView deleteButton, java.lang.String documentID)
      Check that the user and trades have been loaded in properly before proceeding to physically process the trade in the DB
      void deleteTradeDB(android.widget.TextView deleteButton, java.lang.String tradeDocumentID)
      Processes the deletion of a User's active trade in the DB and returns the deposited amount back to the user; once done, it automatically refreshes the user's attributes at the top of the screen
      protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Initialize the objects and TextViews required for this page, including ScrollView of trades
      void onItemSelected(android.widget.AdapterView<?> parent, android.view.View view, int position, long id)
      Updates the current selection of resource to sell/receive
      void onNothingSelected(android.widget.AdapterView<?> parent)
      Sets the default for the spinner
      protected void populateExistingDeals()
      Re-populates the ScrollView with the trades read from the DB
      void postTrade(java.lang.String sellType, java.lang.String receiveType, int sellQty, int receiveQty)
      Check that the user and trades have been loaded in properly before proceeding to physically process the trade in the DB
      void postTradeDB(java.lang.String sellType, java.lang.String receiveType, int sellQty, int receiveQty)
      Method called for a User to post a new trade; we need to add the new trade to the trades collection in the DB; this will show a helpful toast if the user input negative numbers, if the User does not have enough resources, or if previous trade actions are still being processed; when this method is invoked, it sets a flag, postingTrade, that only resolves once this trade is entirely finished being processed (logically and physically in DB); once done, it also automatically refreshes the trade list
      void readUserAndPopulateTrades()
      Read in User by userID, update all the textViews at top of page, flags that the User has been loaded in, then also reads in all trades, populates the ScrollView, flags that the trades have been loaded in
      protected void refreshUserAttributes()
      Refreshes the TextViews that display the User attributes at the top of the page
      private void showToast(java.lang.String msg)
      Convenient method that properly formats then displays a toast message

        sellType - the resource being sold
        receiveType - the resource requested
        sellQty - the amount of resource being sold
        receiveQty - the amount of resource requested

        acceptButton - the button to update the status of the trade
        documentID - which refers to the trade in the DB

      • deleteTradeDB

        public void deleteTradeDB(android.widget.TextView deleteButton,
                          java.lang.String tradeDocumentID)
        Processes the deletion of a User's active trade in the DB and returns the deposited amount back to the user; once done, it automatically refreshes the user's attributes at the top of the screen
        Parameters:
        tradeDocumentID - that corresponds to the documentID in the trades collection

      • postTradeDB

        public void postTradeDB(java.lang.String sellType,
                        java.lang.String receiveType,
                        int sellQty,
                        int receiveQty)
        Method called for a User to post a new trade; we need to add the new trade to the trades collection in the DB; this will show a helpful toast if the user input negative numbers, if the User does not have enough resources, or if previous trade actions are still being processed; when this method is invoked, it sets a flag, postingTrade, that only resolves once this trade is entirely finished being processed (logically and physically in DB); once done, it also automatically refreshes the trade list
        Parameters:
        sellType - the resource being sold
        receiveType - the resource requested
        sellQty - the amount of resource being sold
        receiveQty - the amount of resource requested

      • acceptTradeDB

        public void acceptTradeDB(android.widget.TextView acceptButton,
                          java.lang.String tradeDocumentID)
        Method called for a User (the buyer) to accept a trade; we need to process this for the current user as well as for the person who posted the trade (the seller), finally we also need to delete this trade from the trades collection in the DB; this will show a helpful toast message if the buyer does not have enough enough resources, or if previous trade actions are still being processed; when this method is invoked, it sets a flag, acceptingTrade, that only resolves once this trade is entirely finished being processed (logically and physically in DB); once done, it automatically refreshes the user's attributes at the top of the screen
        Parameters:
        tradeDocumentID - that corresponds to the documentID in the trades collection
